name: Kepler-212
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-212 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-212 is a star with 1.8949999999999991 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.46 times its radius. It is located 2286.48 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-212 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-212 b

Kepler-212 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 16.26 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-212.

The mass of Kepler-212 b is 1.18 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-212 b is 1.09 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-212 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-212 c

Kepler-212 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.21 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 31.81 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-212.

The mass of Kepler-212 c is 10.76 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-212 c is 2.74 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-212 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-212, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
